Message.Title: Check out Yahoo Japan's stock price - Holy Mackeral
Message.Msg: Symbol - Yahoy
Peter Stabler of Wells Fargo will have to raise his PT.

Google Inc has acquired Wavii, the Seattle-based startup behind a news summarization app, for roughly $30 million in cash, a person with knowledge of the matter said Tuesday. Google's successful bid came after Apple Inc had expressed interest in buying Wavii to incorporate the startup's natural language technology into Siri, Apple's voice-activated personal assistant feature, said the person, who declined to be named because the deal has not been publicly announced. Google and Wavii declined to comment. Google's purchase comes several weeks after Yahoo Inc paid a similar amount to acquire Summly, the news reader and Wavii competitor founded by 18-year-old Nick D'Aloisio in London.
Google is a step behind Marissa Mayer.

YHOO late to mobile...maybe, but their new apps are the best. Especially yahoo with summly. It's a new paradigm with respect to ease of use and speed. You can "surf" all day --- very addictive. They are rolling out the hits to keep momentum. The 50% increase in 3mos (200-300mm) will continue IMHO. They are still learning how to price mobile but Marissa says that mobile ads are as effective as PC, but not priced equally yet. And on Search, higher revenues last quarter. On Display, she said they are working on frequency vs price and expect to have revenues growing 2nd 1/2 of 2013. Everything she has said so far has been spot on. I'll take her crystal ball over yinvestor... or anybody else's.

Message.Title: How long does it take Yahoo to "review"' a suggestion?
Message.Msg: My suggestion has been under review since Feb. 21st.

Yahoo is definitely not late. Did you see the Flickr app launch a few months ago? Great reviews. The weather app they launched the other day probably got more amazing reviews than any Yahoo product they've come out with in the past 5 years! And that was just a weather app! Think about what they are going to do to their core apps like Fantasy Sports ad Finance where add dollars will pour in if the designs are anything as cool as the weather app. Yahoo isn't late....they're just early for tomorrow!!
I think you struck a nerve. Hotmodel is bouncing off the walls.

Message.Title: Next magic number
Message.Msg: All we need is $.25 cents to break 52wk high again!!! Can YHOO get there tomorrow?

You need to hold your horses for a sec! Mobile isn't going to be some ginormous cash cow its simply EVOLUTION trying to keep up. Ad dollars from PC's will go down, mobile will go up, net impact NOTHING. Newspapers are going through this and Facebook has been facing this for the past year with 70% of their users accessing FB on smartphones. FB didn't hit some monster revenue stream they've just reformatted the ads to fit mobile devices moving money from one pocket to the other. They're much less efficient with a lower click-thru rate, last I read. Considering Bartzy dismantled the mobile team, a few years ago, they've come a LONG way but as for it dramatically improving the bottom line I don't think so. You'll see them continue to get in bed with the smartphone/tablet/Google Glass makers as they need the latest and greatest platforms to be successful.
Once Yahoo breaks $25 it's a fast track to $27 and all those price targets.

Message.Title: NYT has an excellent read on why Yahoo! acquired the rights to SNL...
Message.Msg: An excerpt from NYT article: "Erin McPherson, a Yahoo vice president who oversees the company’s video business, said the company jumped at the “S.N.L.” opportunity. She said the “S.N.L.” clips would be “widely distributed” across Yahoo, suggesting a strategy that will go beyond the current Yahoo Screen site. “Rather than competing with Hulu, Netflix or any other platform, we see this as a step toward adding scale and breadth to the great content we are already offering users,” Ms. McPherson said..."
But you have curling leagues, so that's a nice thing, eh?
The board reads much better with the nuance gone.
